Package frc.utils

Class CheapCanPidController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revrobotics.CANPIDController
      • frc.utils.CheapCanPidController
  • public class CheapCanPidController
extends com.revrobotics.CANPIDController
    Small wrapper around CANPIDController to reduce CAN usage and overhead. Only flushes output when the desired parameters are different than the current parameters.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setReference

        public com.revrobotics.CANError setReference​(double value,
                                             com.revrobotics.ControlType controlType)
        Sets the desired reference point for the PID controller in a given slot. If any of the values are different than the previous time that values were written, they will be written to the motor controller again. If, however, all of the values are the same, nothing will be output to the motors.
        Overrides:
        setReference in class com.revrobotics.CANPIDController
        Parameters:
        value - the set point for the pid controller.
        controlType - the ControlType to use as the control mode for the PID controller.
        Returns:
        an CANError reporting the success or failure of the operation. A CANError.kOK implies that the command was successfully carried out with no errors.

      • setReference

        public com.revrobotics.CANError setReference​(double value,
                                             com.revrobotics.ControlType controlType,
                                             int pidSlot)
        Sets the desired reference point for the PID controller in a given slot. If any of the values are different than the previous time that values were written, they will be written to the motor controller again. If, however, all of the values are the same, nothing will be output to the motors.
        Overrides:
        setReference in class com.revrobotics.CANPIDController
        Parameters:
        value - the set point for the pid controller.
        controlType - the ControlType to use as the control mode for the PID controller.
        pidSlot - the pid slot that the values should be set for. Must be in range [0, 3].
        Returns:
        an CANError reporting the success or failure of the operation. A CANError.kOK implies that the command was successfully carried out with no errors.

      • setReference

        public com.revrobotics.CANError setReference​(double value,
                                             com.revrobotics.ControlType controlType,
                                             int pidSlot,
                                             double arbFeedForward)
        Sets the desired reference point for the PID controller in a given slot. If any of the values are different than the previous time that values were written, they will be written to the motor controller again. If, however, all of the values are the same, nothing will be output to the motors.
        Overrides:
        setReference in class com.revrobotics.CANPIDController
        Parameters:
        value - the set point for the pid controller.
        controlType - the ControlType to use as the control mode for the PID controller.
        pidSlot - the pid slot that the values should be set for. Must be in range [0, 3].
        arbFeedForward - an arbitrary feed forward output in percent output.
        Returns:
        an CANError reporting the success or failure of the operation. A CANError.kOK implies that the command was successfully carried out with no errors.
